dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Boris Johnson is really doubling down on this October 31st deadline, isn't he? I just don't see how it's feasible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Boris Johnson is really doubling down on this October thirty first deadline, isn't he? I just don't see how it's feasible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson urged MPs to vote against Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn and his pointless delay as he doubled down on his oft-repeated promise to leave the trading bloc by October 31 come what may.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, uh, he seems to think the EU is more likely to deal now because they see Britain's serious. But those rebel Conservative MPs, like, they're making things messy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, uh, he seems to think the E U is more likely to deal now because they see Britain's serious. But those rebel Conservative MPs, like, they're making things messy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that the chances of a deal are rising because the EU can see that Britain wants a deal, adding that the bloc may be discouraged by rebel MPs' actions, accusing them of making further negotiations absolutely impossible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Messy? He's threatening to expel them from the party if they vote against him! That's not messy, that's ruthless.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Messy? He's threatening to expel them from the party if they vote against him! That's not messy, that's ruthless.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It follows reports that Johnson is gearing up to expel or block opposition Tory MPs from standing for election in the next election, if they support the opposition attempts to pass a law to block the U.K. from leaving the EU without a trade deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but he claims their actions could, um, discourage the EU from negotiating further. He says it makes a deal "absolutely impossible."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but he claims their actions could, um, discourage the E U from negotiating further. He says it makes a deal absolutely impossible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that the chances of a deal are rising because the EU can see that Britain wants a deal, adding that the bloc may be discouraged by rebel MPs' actions, accusing them of making further negotiations absolutely impossible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And what about this emergency cabinet meeting on Tuesday? Feels like everything's moving toward a snap election, even though he says he doesn't want one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And what about this emergency cabinet meeting on Tuesday? Feels like everything's moving toward a snap election, even though he says he doesn't want one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson held an emergency cabinet meeting on Monday afternoon amid rumors the prime minister would call for a snap election.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he insisted, "I don't want an election, you don't want an election." But the opposition is pushing for a three-month delay if there's no deal by October 20.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he insisted, I don't want an election, you don't want an election. But the opposition is pushing for a three-month delay if there's no deal by October twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Opposition MPs are reportedly proposing a three-month Brexit delay if Johnson does not strike a deal at the European Council, a summit of EU leaders, on October 19.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which they only have a week to try and legislate, thanks to prorogation. No wonder protesters were chanting "stop the coup" outside Downing Street.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which they only have a week to try and legislate, thanks to prorogation. No wonder protesters were chanting stop the coup outside Downing Street.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnsons move to suspendor prorogueParliament last week under the guise of a procedure known as the Queens speech, where a government sets out its agenda for the year, means that oppositions MPs have just a week to draft a bill and secure the votes needed to make it law. Protesters could be heard chanting stop the coup outside Downing Street as Johnson delivered his speech.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It does feel like a constitutional showdown. And if there is an election this year, that'd be the third in five years—pretty unprecedented.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It does feel like a constitutional showdown. And if there is an election this year, that'd be the third in five years-pretty unprecedented.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If an election is called this year, it would be the third in five years in the U.K., following votes in 2015 and 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Unprecedented and, honestly, exhausting for everyone. Do you think delaying again would actually help, or just prolong the uncertainty?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unprecedented and, honestly, exhausting for everyone. Do you think delaying again would actually help, or just prolong the uncertainty?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Hard to say. Johnson's to believe any delay is "pointless," but the opposition clearly disagrees. It's a total stalemate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hard to say. Johnson's to believe any delay is pointless, but the opposition clearly disagrees. It's a total stalemate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson urged MPs to vote against Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn and his pointless delay as he doubled down on his oft-repeated promise to leave the trading bloc by October 31 come what may.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And all this with thousands protesting across UK cities over the weekend... feels like the country's more divided than ever.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all this with thousands protesting across U K cities over the weekend... feels like the country's more divided than ever.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thousands turned out across cities in the U.K. over the weekend to rally against the suspension of Parliament which was branded unconstitutional and undemocratic by Johnson's opponents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a real mess. Let's see how the votes go this week—could determine everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a real mess. Let's see how the votes go this week-could determine everything.
